section.para: The ngx_stream_js_module module is used to implement handlers in njs — a subset of the JavaScript language.
Download and install instructions are available here.

section.name: Example Configuration

directive.name: js_access
directive.para: Sets an njs function which will be called at the access phase. Since 0.4.0, a module function can be referenced.

directive.name: js_fetch_ciphers
directive.para: Specifies the enabled ciphers for HTTPS connections with Fetch API. The ciphers are specified in the format understood by the OpenSSL library.
The full list can be viewed using the “openssl ciphers” command.

directive.name: js_fetch_protocols
directive.para: Enables the specified protocols for HTTPS connections with Fetch API.

directive.name: js_fetch_trusted_certificate
directive.para: Specifies a file with trusted CA certificates in the PEM format used to verify the HTTPS certificate with Fetch API.

directive.name: js_fetch_verify_depth
directive.para: Sets the verification depth in the HTTPS server certificates chain with Fetch API.

directive.name: js_filter
directive.para: Sets a data filter. Since 0.4.0, a module function can be referenced.

directive.name: js_import
directive.para: Several js_import directives can be specified.

directive.name: js_include
directive.para: The directive is deprecated since 0.4.0, the directive should be used instead.

directive.name: js_path
directive.para: Sets an additional path for njs modules.

directive.name: js_preread
directive.para: Sets an njs function which will be called at the preread phase. Since 0.4.0, a module function can be referenced.

directive.name: js_set
directive.para: Sets an njs function for the specified variable. Since 0.4.0, a module function can be referenced.

The function is called when the variable is referenced for the first time for a given request. The exact moment depends on a phase at which the variable is referenced. This can be used to perform some logic not related to variable evaluation. For example, if the variable is referenced only in the directive, its handler will not be executed until the log phase. This handler can be used to do some cleanup right before the request is freed.

para.note: As the js_set handler returns its result immediately, it supports only synchronous callbacks. Thus, asynchronous callbacks such as ngx.fetch() or setTimeout() are not supported.

directive.name: js_var
directive.para: Declares a writable variable. The value can contain text, variables, and their combination.

section.name: Session Object Properties
section.para: Each stream njs handler receives one argument, a stream session object.
